pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.dbscanTools module¶

Created on 23/04/2012

@author: victor

pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.dbscanTools.dbscan_param_space_search(max_noise, max_eps_tries, number_of_elements, klist, kdist_matrix)[source]¶

Does the search of suitable parameters for DBSCAN. First it generates a grid of minpts-eps values based on the noise limit imposed by the user. Then a new value is added based on (Zhou et al. 2012)

pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.dbscanTools.k_dist(klist, buffer, condensed_distance_matrix)[source]¶
pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.dbscanTools.k_scale_gen(max_elements)[source]¶

Generates a list of ks as powers of 2.

From Zhou et al. 2012 at Journal of Information and Computational Science

pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.parametersGeneration module¶

Created on 27/05/2013

@author: victor

class pyproct.algorithms.dbscan.parametersGeneration.ParametersGenerator(parameters, matrix_handler)[source]¶

Bases: object

classmethod get_base_parameters()[source]¶

Defines the base parameters needed for each of the algorithms. Each created parameter will be based on one of those and must not have more keys than these.

@return: A dictionary with the base parameters for this algorithm.

get_parameters()[source]¶

This function creates some parameters to be used with DBScan. @return: A tuple with the generated parameters and an empty list corresponding to the clusterings.
